definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
strange tales and absurd arguments (idiom)/unreasonable remarks

sentences.english: I enjoy listening to his yarns.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡聽他的奇談怪論。

sentences.english: I shall report some of the strange remarks I heard in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我將介紹一下我在紐約聽到的一些奇談怪論。

sentences.english: A lot of psychology is charlatanry, chicanery.
sentences.chinese: 很多心理學家都是誇誇奇談，不實之徒。

sentences.english: The fact that he picked up the phone to call a college kid speaks wonders.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起電話打給一個大學生本身就可稱爲奇談。

sentences.english: Otherwise if, hard to avoid has justify oneself , the ill will of exaggerated absurd argument.
sentences.chinese: 否則的話，難免有自圓其說，誇大奇談之嫌。

sentences.english: It is nothing but a traveller's tale.
Anecdotal instances are open to the criticism of biased selection .
sentences.chinese: 奇談怪論的例子容易受到帶有偏見的選擇的批評。

sentences.english: Don't talk about your ridiculous arguments, we don't want to hear them.
sentences.chinese: 趕緊收起你的那些奇談怪論，我們並不想聽。

definition: lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
courtesy name of Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云[Zhao4 Yun2], general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
a book on the art of war
